meanings.definition: Make or become urban in character.
meanings.sent1: The small village was urbanized when tall buildings and busy streets were added.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the rural area slowly urbanized into a bustling city.
meanings.sent3: The cows in the field were surprised when they urbanized overnight and found themselves surrounded by skyscrapers.
meanings.sent4: Her mind urbanized, transforming into a concrete jungle of thoughts and ideas.
meanings.sent5: The process of urbanization turned the once quiet neighborhood into a vibrant urban center.

meanings.definition: Develop or be developed into a city or town.
meanings.sent1: The empty land was urbanized into a thriving metropolis with schools and hospitals.
meanings.sent2: The rural area slowly urbanized as more people moved in and businesses opened.
meanings.sent3: The old factory site was urbanized into a lively town square with shops and cafes.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams urbanized into a cityscape of possibilities and opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The once barren land was urbanized into a bustling city full of life and energy.

meanings.definition: Adapt to living in a city or town.
meanings.sent1: The country girl urbanized quickly, learning to navigate the busy streets and crowded spaces.
meanings.sent2: As a small town resident, she had to urbanize her lifestyle when she moved to the city.
meanings.sent3: The suburban family urbanized their routines, trading backyard barbecues for city park picnics.
meanings.sent4: His rural mindset urbanized, embracing the fast-paced city life with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The young couple had to urbanize their habits, adjusting to the noise and lights of the city.
